meanings.definition: Having small, pointed teeth along the edge.
meanings.sent1: The denticulated comb gently untangled her hair.
meanings.sent2: The saw had a denticulated blade for cutting wood.
meanings.sent3: The denticulated edge of the paper made it look like a tiny saw.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was as denticulated as a row of tiny shark teeth.
meanings.sent5: The denticulated leaves of the plant felt rough to the touch.

meanings.definition: Having a toothed or serrated edge.
meanings.sent1: The denticulated knife easily sliced through the bread.
meanings.sent2: The old key had a denticulated pattern on its handle.
meanings.sent3: The denticulated edge of the ruler left a unique pattern on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range looked denticulated against the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The denticulated edge of the cliff made it dangerous to climb.
